content: Expenses Tracking Lifestyle Asked by AnonymousAsked on 17 Feb 2019Bought tickets to Okinawa in May this year for Honeymoon and we are regretting it. Is there anywhere we can sell the tickets?Bought tickets to okinawa in May this year for Honeymoon and we are regretting it. Is there anywhere we can sell the tickets?1 answerAnswerBump1
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Kenneth Lou, Co-founder at SeedlyLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 17 Feb 2019I actually went to Okinawa last week... for 7D6N over the CNY period :)It's actually not too bad a place to go, depending on season of course... perfect for summer weather. Place filled with history and many places to drive around the island :) people there are pretty happy. And okinawa soba is really good.Anyway if you really want to cancel your tickets... i think the only way is to list it on Carousell or ask friends if they may be keen.Then sell your ticket price at: Total price - change name fee (depending on which airline) If you are flying JETSTAR  most likely as a direct flight to Okinawa... then...Looking at this: https://www.jetstar.com/sg/en/help/articles/fees-and-chargesThe Change name fee is $60 per ticket. Hope this helps :) I would think Okinawa is really not bad to go actually... i can send you my itenary. a good mix of nature and shopping also (big malls there and outlet mall not bad)0 comments1
